Fields.DialogueText: Cap, I've got some news.
I'm all ears.
The turkeys sent to Newport News are doing quite well. They even had the gumption to send me some special stamps to commemorate it. Take a peek!
Wow... I've never seen stamps like these.
Figured you wouldn't, Cap. They just released them. Look at how well they drew the turkey...

Fields.MenuText: Lifelike, I'd say.
Did they knit this thing? There's a ton of curves.
Its eye kind of stares into your soul...

Fields.DialogueText: Isn't it? They told me they took great attention to detail, and the results don't lie.
According to the postmaster, they had some artist imitate knitting by way of strokes. ... Hey, Captain, do we have an easel?
You've got to assert yourself, Captain. Don't let it get power over you: that's one of the first rules of the game.
Taking up painting at a time like this?
It's never too late to start on another hobby, Cap. That's how character's built.
I suppose...
Well, you can suppose your way to battle stations. I can sense some Morganas about.
Oh, you do? Well, I guess we can take care of them and...
And what?
Maybe we should go fishing?
I'd be up for that. I want to see if you've gotten any better at it.
Fishing? Maybe. Being in battle? Most certainly.
Show me what you've got then, because they're coming in hot!
@BATTLE
What are you doing, Cap? You've been fiddling with that stamp for a while now.

Fields.MenuText: I'm just admiring the detail. You know how it is.
Beauty is in the eye of the beholder.
It's got this kind of aura of smugness to it—mocking me as I look.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't I ever. It's all in the details sometimes. You've got to measure the minuscule.
If you like that stamp, there's another one in Aylwin's collection you'd love. It's got this beautiful illustration of a daisy...
I didn't know a stamp could have "smug aura." How is it smug, Cap? It isn't even smiling!
Come on, Hull; you can see it, can't you? Look at that eye: unblinking, unflinching, and with a bit of a mean glint...
I think you're reading too much into it, Cap. It's probably got to do with how the artist drew it.
Small things, big impacts... just like those chicks.
Same with getting rid of those Morgs.
I wouldn't call what we do small...
Oh come on, Cap. When you've seen a big Nova Scotian moose, nothing scares you anymore! That's one of the biggest things on this earth.
I just hope we don't—
*BEEP BEEP BEEP*
Huh? Who's telegraphing us at this time of day?
Let me see if my codespeak is still up to snuff. Hm... 'H-Q-T-O-H-U-L-L-STOP-N-E-W-M-I-S-S-I-O-N-O-R-D-E-R-STOP'. A new mission directive?
We'll have to replay that message in a bit, Hull. We've got company!
What? Oh, damn. I didn't notice them at all. I must be getting rusty, Cap. I'm sorry.
It's all in the details, right? No problem.
Heh! Let's see if you can spot all the details during battle, hm?
@BATTLE
Well, Captain? What did it say?
We've got new orders, Hull.
New orders? I thought we were supposed to be on patrol.
There's some nasty Morganas causing problems in the Gulf of Maine.
Aren't Morganas causing problems around here, too?

Fields.MenuText: Not as bad as there. They capped it off with PAN-PAN.
It's bad enough to where they can't consistently ship out supplies.
Hull, we've got to intervene. They directly called us.

Fields.DialogueText: That urgent? Ah, heck. Something must be making a real mess over there.
Uck! If we don't get our lanes clear, there's a good chance those Germans will get the upper hand on England...
If they really did... Wonder what's going on out there with the Morgs that's got them so riled up?
Whatever's going on over there, we've got to to get going.
If there's a big enough Morgana... Ohoh, I feel a hunt coming on.
I don't know if they described it as one or if it's a bunch. It was sent hastily.
Hastily? How could you tell?
Just take a look at the telegram I received not too long after the morse code.
... Good criminy, this filled with errors! What even is that word underneath "help?"
Your guess is as good as mine, Hull.  I just chose to read all of it as "get over here now, please."
Sound reading, but we'll have to clear a path, Cap.
Feel like giving your guns a workout?
Stay behind me, Cap.
@BATTLE
10 meters... 20 meters...
Hull? Is something the matter?
Oh, Cap, good. You're just in time. Look over there. Do you see the goose with the black head?
The one with the little tuft of white near his eyes? Isn't that a Canadian goose?
Not so. Take a look at the back feathers. Notice anything about them?

Fields.MenuText: Is it the eyes? They're kind of yellow.
Oh, I've got it! It's the head: it looks kind of shorter.
Might be the feathers... They're a bit silvery.

Fields.DialogueText: I think that's the sun's reflection, Cap...
That's an incredibly good eye you've got, Cap. Not many people notice the slight height difference.
There you go! That's what we're looking for.
So what are these supposed to be? Are they kind of a rare bird?
Branta leucopsis, Cap: the barnacle goose. They don't come around Rhode Island often... They don't breed anywhere except the Arctic!
Then what are they doing here? Is it because of the climate?
I'd wager it might be due to the war. The world is turning itself on its head with all of this.
*snicker*
What's so funny, Cap? The world's turned upside down!
No, no, it's not that. I got the mental image of a Morgana in an elf outfit and I'm giggling at it.
... *snicker*
Their little horns would be poking out and—oh, wait, there's one now... Are you ready, Hull?
Pahahahahahahahaha!
Eh... We'll figure it out.
@BATTLE
Hmm, no sign of it around here...
What's up, Hull?
Oh, good morning, Cap. I'm currently looking on the water's edge for trails.
Trails? What are you talking about? Trails of... waves?
There's something I've noticed about the Morgs, Cap. They tend to leave these trails in a certain area just after they leave.
Are you sure that's how they do it? Morganas are ethereal, aren't they?
That's why you have to look at the waves, Cap. If they're rumbling in a different way, you can see where the Morganas are going.
Hmm. Maybe it's just too early in the morning, but I can't see it.
I guess we'll need to work on your hunting skills, then.
Hunting a Morgana and hunting an animal are two different things, aren't they?
Pah! Anything can be tracked if you're a good enough hunter. Look over there near the coast.
Huh, that artillery battery has seen better days...
What else do you notice, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: There's a few wisps coming out of that salvo hole over there.
Wait... are those waves over there moving backwards?
... Is that a light in the distance?

Fields.DialogueText: Telltale sign of a Morgana salvo. You can even see the green lines coming out of the wisps near the top.
Good eye. Depending on where Morganas are moving, they'll make the waves move with them.
I don't think I see any light, Cap. There's just the weird sea and the salvo marks.
I don't know, Hull, it looks like it's getting closer.
What are you? ... Oh, I see.
I'll tell you where I'm looking now, Hull: the battle stations.
Crafty Morgana... Looks like I'll have to reevaluate my strategy. But I think I'm heading in the right direction. What do you think, Cap?
Teach me some more when we're done, huh?
Yessir. I'd be right happy to.
@BATTLE
No wonder they needed our help.
Cap, you got a minute?
Sure do. What's that you got there? Some kind of signal flare?
It's a tracking flare. When we see that Morgana, all I have to do is fire it at it, make sure it hits, and then boom: we can follow the light.
How do you think we'll place the flare on the Morgana?
Simple. We lure it out by getting the others riled up. When it comes, we stick it with the flare.

Fields.MenuText: Won't it just go through the Morgana?
I doubt that a Morgana that crafty would stay in one place for that long.
That's pretty ingenious. Where did you get that flare?

Fields.DialogueText: Traded a turkey stamp to Aylwin for it. Can't slip anything by her.
That's why you have to be quick about it, Cap. You know the rules about hunting.
Have any of our salvos gone through the Morganas?
There was that incident at Louisiana.
That Morgana got lucky. I'm going to mount this one's bell in the mess when I'm done with it!
Time to go hunting again, then.
Glad to have you as my co-hunter then, Cap. We'll get that Morgana in no time.
Care to get a little bit of target practice in? I can see a few off in the distance.
That means we're getting closer, Cap.
Close as in range or close as in finding the particular Morgana?
Wouldn't you like to know?
I would, Hull. I'm the Captain.
Oh... Oh! Excuse me, I forgot that—ahem! Let's have at it then.
*chuckle*
@BATTLE
The waters are rather quiet today.
It's because it knows we're hunting for it.
A-Ah! Hull, how long have you been hiding behind that curtain!?
Element of surprise, Cap. We'll need it to get at that Morgana. Have we seen her yet?

Fields.MenuText: Not yet. Though your advice is helping.
I've only heard about it through transmissions.
Actually, yesterday we picked up something large.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm glad it is. You've gotten a lot more observant, Cap. Let's keep at it.
Well, that just means we have to keep searching for it.
You did!? Did you notice anything about it when they picked it up?
Large for a Morgana.
Hoho... The bigger they are, the bigger they fall. I'm getting kind of excited here.
That's the spirit! With any luck, we should be able to track it down soon. It's been staying in a general area...
If we can sketch out a stomping ground, we can follow its pattern in reverse and come face to face.
How do you know it won't change course?
It'll stay the course if we condition it. Then, when it's gotten comfortable enough, we'll switch it up. It's an old Powhatan tactic.
Those are a native tribe, right?
Some of the best hunters on the East Coast.
Care to put some of that knowledge to use? We've got company.
Of course, Cap.
Oh, could you tell me more about the Powhatan later? I'm intrigued.
Only if you let me see how good your shooting is!
@BATTLE
You're doing great, Cap. That's the most focused I've seen you in a while.
I'm not focused, though. I'm just tired.
Why so, Cap? You've already caught about five of them. Don't tell me you're ready to throw in the towel?
No, it's just been a long day. Getting sent orders from Command, trying to track out elusive Morganas, breaking up some fights on the deck...
Fights? Why would people be fighting at a time like this?

Fields.MenuText: Imagine someone called you a goldplater to your face.
Don't you and your sisters fight sometimes?
I wish it didn't have to be like that. We're all in this together.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd be a bit upset, but I wouldn't simply deck somebody in the face. That's rude.
We fight sometimes, but no one has to intervene. In the end, we all come to agree on our shared differences.
Always, huh?
... Maybe not Worden. Sometimes she broods for a bit before apologizing.
I feel you, Cap. Some days, all I hear is "Goldplater" and my mood... well, I don't let it get to me, mostly.
Guess that's the way some people are.
That doesn't mean you shouldn't keep wishing for peace, Cap. Or at least peace enough for you to feel at ease.
It's only been about a year since the war started and I already feel like a tired senior.
Is that why you're fishing?
Are you calling yourself old, too? We're both fishing.
We're already a pair of old-timers. Well, we were also parents at one point, too.
Now all we have left to do is become globe-trotters.
And hunters, of course. Looks like life's presenting us that chance right now.
What are the odds? Let's get moving, Hull.
@BATTLE
Well, we just passed Provincetown. But there's still no sign of our target.
Hull, are you all right? You haven't talked in over half an hour.
Shh. Remember what I said, Cap. Be patient.
Right, right. Don't draw attention to yourself.
*SEVERAL SILENT MINUTES LATER*
Captain! We've detected a large object, 10 knots to 25, northeast! It is traveling at an estimated 4 knots and is continuing northeast.
Well, I'll be...
It looks like we've found our target. All right, Cap, you remember how to do this?
Right away. Increase speed to 5 knots, prime primary salvo.
Keep a steady distance as well. We don't want to go spooking it.

Fields.MenuText: Can Morganas even get scared?
We're smaller than it, though.
Slow and steady, slow and steady.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm about to see if they can be.
David was smaller than Goliath. Don't let her fool you.
With your rifle in hand...
Hold it firm. Line up the crosshairs. Approach slowly...
Then, when you've lined it up, take the shot. Good job, Cap. Glad you remembered!
All right, steady as she goes...
Captain! Two enemies approaching from 180, due south!
Oh for the love of—
Looks like we weren't the only ones who wanted it.
@BATTLE
Wait, did it get away!?
Navigator! Status report, pronto!
No sign of original subject, Captain! Sector is clear!
Damn it. It really did get away...
Awww, don't take it too personally, Cap. You'll have your chance again. Especially if this thing keeps stalking this area.

Fields.MenuText: I just don't want it causing any more trouble.
How can you be so sure?
If only they hadn't interrupted us.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't either, but sometimes a quarry will elude you for a time. That's what makes hunting fun.
I've been hunting since I was built, Cap. Trust me, I know how these things work. Us Belles also have a sixth sense for Morganas, so not much to worry about.
It appears these Morganas have some diversionary tactics of their own. Clever girls.
If you have a sixth sense for Morganas, what's the point of the tracking flare?
So that you and the rest of the crew can spot it before I take a shot.
Wouldn't you be better at the element of surprise than us, though?
You need to learn, Cap.
Heh. Point taken. Navigator, are there any other Morganas around?
Captain... Detecting a couple of Morganas off the port side. Engage?
Hull?
Pfft. As if you need to ask...
@BATTLE
What have you got there, Hull?
A letter from Aylwin. It was sent yesterday after the battle and I just received it.
What is she saying? Something good, I hope?
Mostly checking in, asking where have I been, and how I should visit. But there's something else here, too: she knows about our big Morgana.
She does now, huh? I take it she has a few choice words about it.
Oh she does. Including: "If you can't take care of that big bad Morgy, leave it to me. I'm better suited for it."

Fields.MenuText: She's rather confident.
What does she think we're doing? Sitting around?
Now are you reading that? Or are you *reading* that?

Fields.DialogueText: Incredibly cheeky, she is. I'll tell you one thing she's wrong about, though: I don't need to leave it to her. I'm going to get that Morgana.
I don't know what she thinks we're doing. But I know for a fact we're not lazing about. If she thinks that we're going to just lead this Morgana to her... she's got another thing coming.
What do you mean, Cap? She's mocking us.
The last time I checked, "I'm better suited for it" doesn't look like "If you need some help, I can come."
That's what she wants us to... Hm, Cap... You've kind of... Darn it. You've got a point.
Don't worry on it too much. We'll both band together, catch that Morgana by surprise, and then come back to tell Aylwin all about if she wants.
I'm going to enjoy showing her that Morg's anchor if we can get any souvenirs.
I doubt she'll just let us take a trophy with a wink and a curtsey.
Care to try right now, Cap? I think I see a couple off in the distance.
Element of surprise, right?
You're getting it now, Cap!
@BATTLE
Boston's a lot more quiet than I remember it being. Where's all the fuss? No clams? No heckling?
Apparently, after that Morgana came through, they evacuated this port in particular. It's a real menace.
No kidding. We really have to pick up the slack, don't we?
We'll need to pick up supplies first. It's going to storm later on and we'll need extras.
Chasing after a Morgana in a storm... that's going to be challenging.

Fields.MenuText: Didn't we just raise a bunch of turkeys in your hull?
Says the Belle crazy enough to bring a moose on her ship.
I like a little bit of craziness in my missions.

Fields.DialogueText: That's true, but I don't think that comes close to what they're implying we do here.
That was one moose and the weather was nice, Cap. This is a full-fledged hunt during a storm.
Are you really sure you're up for this level of craziness? Hunters have to be reserved, and we'll have to move a lot slower in the storm.
You've got to be a little crazy to go after something like that. She won't expect us if we do.
She won't expect us, sure. But we also need to not get shipwrecked before we get to her.
Hull, I have absolute confidence in you. I say that with the most certainty I can muster. You've weathered storms before.
Cap... Hm, I'll do what I can. Oh, that reminds me, have you ever seen a mayflower before?
Isn't that Massachusetts's state flower? Is it yellow like a marigold?
It's yellow on the inside. Hold on... Let me flip to the... Here it is.
Huh, it looks kind of like a jasmine.
Same color, not the same family. I think I could use a bigger one. Do you think you could go pick one?
Let's do that later. Right now... Oh, they're getting closer.
Well, well, well. Can't search for flowers when we've got some rabble rousers.
@BATTLE
Got something in mind?
Tarps and ropes and whatnot. You can never batten down too much.
Cap, do you got a minute?
What's going on, Hull? You look kind of glum.
Well, I was thinking on what Aylwin wrote the other day. ... Maybe I read it wrong?
It happens to the best of us. I read telegrams wrong sometimes.
No, Cap, this is a bit different. It's... Well, you know how those other old destroyers call me "Goldplater?"
I don't really like that nickname for you, but yes. Why?
I just... I feel like I rushed into Sis's letter without really thinking about what she actually wrote. When she asked me if I needed help, my mind brought back all of those backroom talks...

Fields.MenuText: It's not what you're called, Hull; it's what you answer to.
They can talk all they want, but they'll never know you.
Do you think Aylwin feels the same way?

Fields.DialogueText: Cap... I... I'm sorry. Sometimes it really gets to you, you know? You try so hard, do all those things, and yet you still don't...
You say that, but they've got a lot more experience than I do.
That doesn't mean they're going to be right all the time. Calling other people names—not even to their face—is unprofessional and rude. You're more than a name, Hull.
... Now that you mention it, she has mentioned being called "Goldplater" before. But she just laughs it off instead of, y'know.
But, Cap... Do you really see it that way?
Take me, for example. You call me Cap, but I know you mean "Captain." I've had people call me names I wouldn't call my dog to my face, but I don't give them the time of day. You shouldn't either.
I'm sorry, Cap... you're right. I just wish they could say it to my face, at least.
I suggest those destroyers look in the mirror first before they go around calling you a "Goldplater."  They've got a lot of nerve.
Thanks, Cap. Seriously, I appreciate you bearing with—oh, speaking of nerves...
Just what we needed. Would you like to get some of those pent-up feelings out?
Heck yes.
@BATTLE
Cap! Look out beyond. Do you see that!?
My lord, it's huge...
That's 100% the Morg we're looking for right there. If we can get close, I can plant the signal flare on it!
Roger, moving in...
Wait, where'd all these other Morganas come from!?
Doesn't matter. Let's take 'em all out, Hull.
Dang! If we could just get in range... Okay, Cap, let's do it.
@BATTLE
Kuh! When they said that Morg was fast, they weren't kidding!
Come on... Just a little more...
Cap, I'm in range...
Wait for it...
... Okay, Hull, take the shot.
*POW*
*PLINK! FSSSSSS...*

Fields.MenuText: Hull, that was amazing!
Holy... I swear you could hit a plane out of the sky with your eyes closed.
She's a fast one!

Fields.DialogueText: Hehe! Thank you, Cap. All we have to do now is give her the business when we find her.
Tsk, tsk, tsk! I don't think I can do that yet. I'd love to try it one day. But I can reliably hit a moving target better than most, at sea or on land.
You're telling me. That gal could give Dewey a run for her money. Still, we got the flare down, and that's what matters.
Seriously, that shot was wicked good. Can we practice later?
We have to work on you holding your rifle first, Cap! Hehehehehe...
Guh, don't remind me.
Come on, come on...
Got her!
Let's see... Adjust about 10 inches, and... huph!
What's going on, Cap? Fishing again?
Sure am. We've cleared out the area of Morganas, and from what I've heard shipping's starting up again. So I decided to fish.
It looks like you've already caught a couple. How many have you tossed back?
About six, I'm sad to say.
Why so? We've got the Morgana tracked, shipping's starting up again, and now we're getting closer to getting our quarry than ever.
Maybe it's because we've let it go on for this long. I'm supposed to be stopping this Morgana and it just keeps getting away.
Well, Cap, that's part of the thrill of the hunt, after all. Though I understand your frustration. The war is...
That's one of the things I'm worried about. We might be wasting time that we don't have and we still haven't cornered this big one.
Hmm... Well, let me ask you about this, Cap: do you know what intuition is?

Fields.MenuText: It's sort of "knowing things instinctively," right?
I know it's a state of being. Isn't it a song?
I know what intuition is, Hull.

Fields.DialogueText: Correct. It's all about what you feel and not what you see. But it means more than just knowing in the "know" - it's about knowing what you've got. If that makes sense.
State of being, yes. Song? Hm, I've never heard a song called "Intuition" before. Not on any record I know. Anyway, Cap, it's all about perspective.
Glad to see that you know about the basics, then. But tell me, Cap, do you know what it means to know what you really *know* at a given time?
What do you mean, Hull?
Going to make it short: you only know what you know sometimes. You can learn, sure, but in the end you can only control yourself. Things happen, and the best you can do is do your best.
You're right about that. I've just never heard it put that way before. I'm sorry, Hull, stuff's got me worrying lately.
Maybe some battling will take your mind off of it? Navigation said we've got some company coming.
If we can talk while we're at it.
'Course we can. Oh, I have to tell you about this duck I saw yesterday... pure white!
@BATTLE
*SPLASH*
*Whistle* *Chirp* Here, boys, get your fixings for the day.
Looks like you've got some new friends, Hull.
Oh no, these are old friends, Cap. Look! Here comes one now.
Are these... seagulls?
These here are herring gulls, Cap. They're native around Europe, North America, and occasionally in Asia. Known for their fur coats and a bit of docility.
They kind of look like they're all over the place with that grain your handing out.
They feed like that, Cap. Remind you of anything back inside the ship itself?

Fields.MenuText: Don't remind me about that. I had to give those recruits a firm talk about making a mess of the mess.
But the sea isn't choppy today.
Correct me if I'm wrong, but it isn't Friday, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: You gave them a talking-to? I wish I could've seen that.
True, though according to our meteorologists there will be a storm tonight. I'm preparing myself for that.
It's not! But there will be a storm tonight of some kind.
I was strong, but firm. I took a couple pages from you, Hull. You choosing to apologize to Aylwin kind of helped me figure out some things.
Aww, well, I'm glad to have helped, Cap. Though I think I'm going to need your help in a bit too, if the sky's any indication.
That's right... It's going to be storming tonight, and what's more, Navigation has said they've picked up our Morgana several times today.
Well, at least we have some time to roost before then.
Ah, that's what birds do when they've found a spot they like, right? They rest their wings for a bit.
Correct, Cap. But it's usually a group of birds that nest and not just a few. Same thing these fellas are going to do tonight.
Wait, have they been nesting inside your—
Oh, Cap, look over there! Target practice! I knew those Morganas wouldn't want to waste a chance...
Hey, Hull—W-We don't have space in the place for... dang it!
@BATTLE
There's one of our guys that keeps them, right?
Good old Brooklyn pigeons. They're no passengers, but I think they can learn to go where they're sent.
It's not exactly what I had in mind, though...
*RAIN*
It's really coming down out there. How are you holding up, Hull?
Doing well, Cap. Just moving it slow.
Wait, are you reading?
Just writing a bit about the prior days, Cap. This whole trip's been a lot of fun for me.

Fields.MenuText: Has it? I thought you weren't liking your quarry.
I hope I've been a good captain.
I didn't know you kept a journal.

Fields.DialogueText: Cap! Of course you've been! Why are you going off saying things like that when we haven't even run into trouble out here?
Far from it! It's not like some random deer in the forest or a fish in the water where if gets away you can catch another. This is a Morgana, a crafty one at that. You and me, though, we'll get her.
Of course I do, Cap. I hate to admit it, but... sometimes my memory isn't that great. It also lets me clear my head when I'm feeling prickly. No matter what, though, I'm still here.
I'm sorry, Hull. I just knew you didn't like traveling through storms like this and felt bad about making you do it.
Oh, relax, Cap. I know it had to be done, too. Like you said, sometimes it's about perspective. Besides, practice makes perfect with storm traveling. T-Thank you for thinking about me, though...
Don't mention it.
I will, because I appreciate it. Hm, how are you doing, Cap? I think I'm spry now.
Well, it's good to know you're with me. I hope I can keep a clear head. The sea's getting a little bit rougher up ahead.
Keep it cool, Cap. If your soul's aflame, you'll be right as rain.
... Hull, I kind of wish we had a fireplace on the bridge.
Wait, I'm not the only one who thinks we should? That's brilliant idea, Cap.
We should probably—
Captain, enemies detected on radar nearby!
—save that thought for later.
Let me just write it down real quick, Cap. I'll be with you in a second. I really like the thought of having a fireplace out here.
@BATTLE
Man, that was a good dinner. Those cooks know what they're doing.
Agreed. Oh, Cap, are you for another piece of cheesecake? This one's got some graham cracker crust...

Fields.MenuText: You can count me out on that. I'm trying to watch my waist.
Sure, why not. I'll take a bite.
I would, but you love it so much that I don't want to steal it.

Fields.DialogueText: Haha! Trying to worm your way out of it, huh? Nah, Cap, I kid, I kid. Thank you for being kind to me. It looks like the sea's calmed down a little bit.
One of these days I'm going to get you to eat it, and you're going to love it! Ah, well, guess it can't be helped. Hm, is it just me, or is the sea a bit calmer?
Here you are. My favorite part is the crust, but the cheesecake itself is pretty good. Could use a bit more sugar, though.
Well, everything's better with sugar. *munch munch munch* Mmm, this is actually pretty good. That graham cracker is really pulling it in big.
Told you you'd love it, didn't I? Really does some good to the soul... Oh, look at that. The ocean is calming down.
According to what I've been hearing from navigation, it's been that way for a while. Hope it's nothing but smooth sailing.
Gentle traveling is what everybody hopes for, but rarely is that the case. What we've got on our hands is a lull, Cap.
A lull? I'm not supposed to sleep for another six hours.
Not like sleep, Cap! I mean a lull in the storm. They happen sometimes. If you're not careful during these times, a bigger wave will hit you before you have a chance to react.
Oh, so we're near the eye then?
Not quite, Cap. There's a legend among the Spanish about this type of thing: when there's a calm spot in the storm, that usually means the worst part is coming soon. So you better hold on.
I'll be sure to do so, then. Have you seen something like that happen before?
I've never been in a storm for this long, so I don't know if this one's a special case.
Special cases usually are more overt than this, I feel. I've seen a couple in my time as captain.
Hmm... I'm feeling a little bit of choppiness in the water already. Is it starting up again?
No, that's just the Morganas.
Oh, it's just the Morganas... Hey! Wait a minute!? They're that close!
Battle stations then! Give Hull some personal space!
Gonna show these demons a real storm for getting this close...
@BATTLE
Well, Hull, you were right about that whole calm before the s-s-storm...!
Getting a little bit choppy for you there, Cap? You can hold onto me if you like.
T-Thanks, Hull. I sometimes forget you have these safety rails.
I meant my... Pffthahahahaha!
Oh! Your arm. Sorry to leave you hanging.
No worries, Cap, I know it's confusing. Anyhow... Storm's coming on big now. Maybe we're getting closer to our target?
I doubt whoever that Morgana is would like to see us any more than we do in this miserable weather.
The prey often gets scared when it's cornered. In a sea like this, there aren't that many places to run.

Fields.MenuText: That includes us, you know.
I wouldn't be surprised if she blended into the waves.
"The cornered rat will bite the cat."

Fields.DialogueText: That's what a mousetrap's for, but at least it rhymes. But I understand what you're saying, Cap. We should be careful.
Hm, good point. Though, I don't see why you would need to hide your face out here when it doesn't really matter. Seeing yourself is important—so take that, old desroyers.
True, but we have something they don't. We've got level heads and we can see where they are thanks to the signal flare...
Huh? Hull, what is..?
Huh, that looks like the signal flare's light going off! Man, that sucker's been burning for... Oh.
*KRACKOOM*
Are those all... eyes?
Oh, my.
Navigation! How many enemies are there!?
We've just picked them all up, Captain. We're surrounded!
Damn... It looks like we're the  ones who were caught.
Come on, Cap.
Hull?
Take my hand and keep your cool. I'll show you that no matter how big something is, it's always got a target on its head...
Incoming a tiny barrage of Morgana! Your orders, Captain!?
Blast 'em through!
@BATTLE
Like shooting fish in a barrel.
Don't get too ahead of yourself, Hull, there's still more. And that big one's firepower is hurting us something fierce.
Let it tire itself out then, Cap. This thing isn't going to sink me or you. By the way, have you seen my journal? I need to write that "fish in a barrel" line down.

Fields.MenuText: W-Writing at a time like this!? We're in combat!
Hull... What are you?
I *wish* I had half the bravery you have.

Fields.DialogueText: You can't show fear in these situations, Cap. The beast is trying to make itself look bigger than you are and you've got to stand your ground.
I'm one of a kind, Cap. You should know that about me by now! Keep your chin up, buddy, I'm still here with you.
Lines like that only come to you in the heat of the moment, so I want to write it down. Deep breaths, Cap. Deep breaths. I'm not going anywhere.
Hull... Rgh, all right! Let's keep pressing our luck!
I still can't believe a Morgana like that needs all these little ships to protect her. With all the heck she's been giving us, you'd think she could do it on her own.
Every good captain is responsible for their crew, no matter what!
Wow, I... Cap that's... I haven't heard something like that out of you in a while. That's...
It's a bit of the adrenaline, but I mean what I say: I'd be nothing without you or my crew, Hull.
W-Whew... Cap, I'm sorry, that knocked the wind out of my sails. I'm kind of... kind of beaming with pride here.
"Higher the pride, higher the fall."
Oh, I know that one! Book of Proverbs! But you're right, Cap, let's break through 'em.
You have any ideas, Hull?
I've got a couple... just you wait and see!
@BATTLE
Another crack of the rifle... If that big one wants to keep dancing around, I can dance too!
Keep it up! How many more do we have to go!?
Can't make heads or tails of it right now. The storm's coming on big, Cap.
That's unfortunate because they're all still around us!
Easy does it, Cap. Panicking is what they want us to do. Remember, deep breaths.
Hands on the rifle, right... Breathe in... Breathe out...
That's it, Cap. Just remain calm and let's take care of these. Little by little, minute by minute.

Fields.MenuText: If that's what it takes...
*Deep Breathing*
Hull, I'm glad you're here.

Fields.DialogueText: Thanks, Cap. I'm glad to be with you, too. If I can time my shots right, I can totally hit that big one...
That's it, Cap. Deep breaths. In, out, in, out; just let your body relax. When you're relaxed, you start thinking more. We're going to get that big game...
You've got to earn your sweet victory and freedom, Cap. It's all about working it out.
How the hell are you even seeing it? Every time I turn around it's somewhere else!
Remember what I said about predicting, Cap? We've just got to lead it on a bit longer.
All right... I trust you, Hull. Let's clear out some more.
Hope they like my cannons. I'm about to show these Morgana what a "Goldplater" can do.
Then let's see you sparkle!
@BATTLE
Storm's picking up again...
Boom, boom, and boom. I'm raking in a ton of trophies from this!
You'd better be ready to earn some more. They're still coming!
Oh, am I ever...
@BATTLE
Looks like we've done it... Navigation, status report!
Captain! Enemies are still approaching, but they're too far away to approach the target!
It's on you, Hull.
What should I do, Cap? They're going to approach soon.

Fields.MenuText: It's hard to say, but I think it's now or never.
This may be the only chance we get here.
Hull.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm good for it if you are, Cap. Just say the word and I'll do what I can. You've helped me get this far.
I have no problem with blowing away more of those Morganas. If anything, my gold plates could use a bit of blemishes. Builds character. So give me your orders.
Cap? You went all serious all of the sudden. (It's kinda cute...)
I've always wanted to say this...
You have, huh? Don't hold back then!
I authorize you, Hull. Take the shot.
I'm on it. All right... You better not blink, Cap, cause this is going to be one heck of a shot.
Steady... skip to south... skip to north...
Phew... Ok.
Gotcha.
*BOOM*
Holy... Hull...
It's all in the technique, Cap. Practice does make perfect.

Fields.MenuText: How long will I have to practice to make a shot like that?
I've never seen a sniper hit something moving that fast at that distance.
You're one of a kind, Hull.

Fields.DialogueText: In good time, Cap. I'll have to teach you some more after we finish this whole thing. If and when, of course; but I think we've got it now.
You've never met me, Cap. If you think that's impressive, you should see what Dewey can do with her cannons. Brighter than the Fourth... And now that Morgana's seeing stars.
C-Cap... Thank you. W-We've got to finish this, though. That Morg's hit pretty bad.
We've definitely got it now, and... What the!? It's trying to get away!
Full speed ahead, then?
Make it so, Hull. But something tells me we're going to have to clear a path. You with me?
Course I am, Cap. *CLICK* Now let's get them.
@BATTLE
It's really trying to get away...
Full speed ahead!
Hm, it's still really fast. I wager if we fight against the sea, we'll only hurt ourselves more.
Damn, there's got to be something we can do here...
The storm's *really* bad now.
Wait... I've got it!
Cap? I haven't seen stars in your eyes like that since...
Hull, you need to adjust course about... 40 degrees to the left.
Wait... Cap, are you—!?

Fields.MenuText: I learned from the best.
Trust me, Hull.
I am, as a matter of fact.

Fields.DialogueText: Cap! You're darn right you did!
Moving to the left! I'm on it, Cap!
Then hold onto your hat!
Wait for it...
... Wait, it's—! It's coming towards us! Cap... You magnificent, sly dog!
Ready, Hull? I can already see that mantelpiece.
I can too, Cap. The hunt... is over.
@BATTLE
And that's the last of her.
Sinking like a ton of bricks! And hey, the storm's stopping, too!
Hull... Thank you so mu—OOF!
*HUG*
I'm still not going to get over that shot. Seriously, that's a once in a lifetime thing.
Aw, Cap... quit it! You're going to make it go to my head! And I'm really glad I landed that shot. That was a bit rough.
Breathe in, breathe out.
Pfft... Cap! That's my line! Though after this whole hunt, I think you've earned the right to use it.
Thank you, Hull. I'll use it well.
I hope you do, 'cause if you don't, I'm going to write a strongly worded letter to you about breathing techniques!

Fields.MenuText: Will it have a special stamp?
Actually, I've been meaning to ask you: can you help me write cursive?
Send a letter to Aylwin first.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha ha ha, very funny. But you can bet that it'll have a stamp of me pointing at you like Uncle Sam!
You don't know how to write cursive, Cap? Well, I'd be glad to teach you some of that next time. You've got a pen, I hope?
Oh! That's right! She'll really want to hear about all this. Can't wait to tell her I've got a Morgana's emblem as a mantelpiece!
Something tells me she already knows.
Knowing her, she's probably already drafting me a letter. I love her so much. She's going to freak out.
No doubt about that.
Hey, Cap? I... I just want to let you know I'm still proud of you, especially after that whole thing. You handled that situation like a champ in the end.
Couldn't have done it without you, Hull. You're a fantastic mentor and an even better fisher and hunter. Wouldn't trade it for the world.
Aww, geez. Now it *really* will go to my head! Thank you, Cap, really. Oh, what do you say we go for some cheesecake? Boston serves up some good ones.
We might want to take care of our guests first. Looks like they're not too happy about you getting their "big one."
Well, tough. They're only going to give us more target practice. You ready, Cap?
That's MY line. Yes, yes I am.
Let's take 'em down, then! With me, Cap!
